div.l: And turnen cuppes / and wel wrastelen ⁊and sheete
Ay bi his belte / he bar a long panade
In stede of a swerd / ful trenchaıı̄unt was the blade
A Ioly popper / bar he in his powche
Ther was no man/ for pereil / durst hym touche
A Sheffeld thwetil / bar he in his hose
Roıı̄und was his face / ⁊and camhed / was his nose
As peled as an ape / was his skulle
He was a market betere / at the fulle
Ther durste no wiht / hond on hym legge
That he ne swoor / he sholde a noon abegge
A theef he was forsothe / of corn ⁊and mele
And that a slih / and vsaunt for to stele
His name was hoten / deynous symkyn
A wyf he hadde / comen of noble kyn
The person of the toıı̄un / hir fadyr was
With hir he yaf / ful many a panne a bras
For that symkyn̄ / wold no wyf wold no wyf shold in his blood allie
She was fostred / in A nonnerye
For symkyn / wold no wyf as he sayde
But she were wel norshed ⁊and a mayde
To saven his astate / of yemanrye
And she was prowd / ⁊and pert as a pye
A ful fayr syhte / was it on hem two
On halidayes / biforn hir wold he go
With his tipet / woıı̄unde a boute his hed
And she cam Aftir / with a gyte of red
And symkyn / hadde hosen of the same
Ther durste no wiht / callen hir but dame
Was noon so hardy / that wente bi the way
That with hir durste rage / or play
But he wolde be slayn of deynous / symkyn
With panade / with knyf / or with boydekyn
For Ielous folk / ben hardy eủer mo
Algate they wolde / her wyfis wenden so
And eke also / for she was somdel smotirlich
She was as dygne / as watir in the diche
Al ful of ful of ful of hokir and of bismare
